STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 12, 2025
Kevin Eaton
Muskegon County Juvenile Detention Center
205 E APPLE AVE,
MUSKEGON, MI, 49442-3406
Re: License #: CO610385814
Dear Kevin Eaton:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 06/11/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
N/A
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and staff noted they enjoy
their jobs. Staff reported feeling supported by their direct supervisor and
administration team. When asked if there was anything they would like to change
or add to their jobs, staff reported they would like to have more trainings on youth
mental health and how they can best work with youth with mental health concerns.
Staff reported there has been more youth with mental health concerns being put
into detention then delinquency type behavior and they would like more training to
support this population. This information was provided to the administration team.
Within the interviews with the administration team, it was reported the facility has
set up a garden for the youth to work with and create their own meals with the
ingredients they have grown. The facility will also be bringing back DBT groups
and other therapeutic groups to work with the youth. The facility is also bringing in
a music professional to help youth learn more about music, lyrics and instruments.

During this inspection youth were interviewed. Each youth reported feeling safe at
the facility and having a positive relationship with staff. They reported staff are able
to use a lot of verbal de-escalation with the youth rather than going hands on for a
restraint. Youth reported that they would like to change the food at the facility
because they wanted better food choices. They reported they would also like to
spend more time outside as they would like to continue to work in the garden and
play basketball for rec time. This information was provided to the administration
team.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on June 11, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
June 11, 2025
____________________________________________
Cathrine Raftery Date
